body: hi,, thanks for the spot, @mloning one for you I think?

I have looked at this, and think this class should be removed. It does not conform to docstrings and requires updating. However,  TSF is a very obscure, never used algorithm that is way behind SOTA. The functionality it encapsulates is available through the concrete implementation. I think we remove this composable classifier. Its easier than updating it and I just donâ€™t see what value it serves. Thoughts @mloning ?

issue.title: [BUG] TypeError when instantiating ComposableTimeSeriesForestClassifier

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Following the tutorials for univariate time series classification, encountered a TypeError bug when running the code found in the section on [time series forests](https://www.sktime.org/en/latest/examples/02_classification_univariate.html#Time-series-forest).

TypeError is thrown when instantiating the ComposableTimeSeriesForestClassifier class as per the example code.

**To Reproduce**

```python
from sktime.transformations.panel.summarize import RandomIntervalFeatureExtractor

steps = [
    (
        "extract",
        RandomIntervalFeatureExtractor(n_intervals="sqrt", features=[np.mean, np.std, _slope])
    ),
    ("clf", DecisionTreeClassifier())
]

time_series_tree = Pipeline(steps)

# Fit and evaluate single time series tree
time_series_tree.fit(x_train, y_train)
time_series_tree.score(x_test, `y_test)`

tsf = ComposableTimeSeriesForestClassifier( # This is where the TypeError is thrown
    estimator=time_series_tree,
    n_estimators=100,
    criterion="entropy",
    bootstrap=True,
    oob_score=True,
    random_state=1,
    n_jobs=-1
)

# Fit and obtain oob score
tsf.fit(x_train, y_train)

if tsf.oob_score:
    print(tsf.oob_score_)
```

**Expected behavior**
ComposableTimeSeriesForestClassifier should be instantiable
OR 
Tutorial should be changed to show correct methodology for using time series forests.

**Additional context**
I believe the issue might be related to __init__ being marked as an abstract method [here.](1ec596b9d5464d21ffb0236730afded23/sktime/series_as_features/base/estimators/_ensemble.py#L88)

**Versions**
<details>
System:
    python: 3.8.3 (tags/v3.8.3:6f8c832, May 13 2020, 22:37:02) [MSC v.1924 64 bit (AMD64)]
executable: c:\users\olive\onedrive - university of east anglia\year 3\computing project (cmp-6013y)\datasets\venv\scripts\python.exe
   machine: Windows-10-10.0.22000-SP0

Python dependencies:
          pip: 21.1.2
   setuptools: 57.0.0
      sklearn: 1.0
       sktime: 0.8.0
  statsmodels: 0.13.0
        numpy: 1.19.5
        scipy: 1.7.1
       Cython: 0.29.24
       pandas: 1.3.4
   matplotlib: 3.4.3
       joblib: 1.1.0
        numba: 0.54.1
     pmdarima: 1.8.3
      tsfresh: 0.18.0
</details>

body:
I am having the same issue - I raised a separate issue #1546 but then found this one which is the same one I am having. I am going to take a look into the issue and see if it can be easily resolved.

**My code**

```python
from sktime.transformations.panel.summarize import RandomIntervalFeatureExtractor

steps = [
    (
        "extract",
        RandomIntervalFeatureExtractor(n_intervals="sqrt", features=[np.mean, np.std, _slope])
    ),
    ("clf", DecisionTreeClassifier())
]

time_series_tree = Pipeline(steps)

# Fit and evaluate single time series tree
time_series_tree.fit(x_train, y_train)
time_series_tree.score(x_test, `y_test)`

tsf = ComposableTimeSeriesForestClassifier( # This is where the TypeError is thrown
    estimator=time_series_tree,
    n_estimators=100,
    criterion="entropy",
    bootstrap=True,
    oob_score=True,
    random_state=1,
    n_jobs=-1
)

# Fit and obtain oob score
tsf.fit(x_train, y_train)

if tsf.oob_score:
    print(tsf.oob_score_)
```

**Expected behavior**
ComposableTimeSeriesForestClassifier should be instantiable
OR 
Tutorial should be changed to show correct methodology for using time series forests.

**Additional context**
I believe the issue might be related to __init__ being marked as an abstract method [here.](1ec596b9d5464d21ffb0236730afded23/sktime/series_as_features/base/estimators/_ensemble.py#L88)

**Versions**
<details>
System:
    python: 3.8.3 (tags/v3.8.3:6f8c832, May 13 2020, 22:37:02) [MSC v.1924 64 bit (AMD64)]
executable: c:\users\olive\onedrive - university of east anglia\year 3\computing project (cmp-6013y)\datasets\venv\scripts\python.exe
   machine: Windows-10-10.0.22000-SP0

Python dependencies:
          pip: 21.1.2
   setuptools: 57.0.0
      sklearn: 1.0
       sktime: 0.8.0
  statsmodels: 0.13.0
        numpy: 1.19.5
        scipy: 1.7.1
       Cython: 0.29.24
       pandas: 1.3.4
   matplotlib: 3.4.3
       joblib: 1.1.0
        numba: 0.54.1
     pmdarima: 1.8.3
      tsfresh: 0.18.0
</details>
@OliverMatthews you could be right, have a go removing it and see if it works, would be a good first issue.

> @OliverMatthews you could be right, have a go removing it and see if it works, would be a good first issue.

Tried removing the abstract tag, didn't work but I think I've identified the issue. Up the chain of abstracted classes is an abstract method called _set_oob_score_and_attributes in sklearn/ensemble/_forest.py that is not implemented in the sktime classes that implement it.

I made some changes so that the ComposableTimeSeriesForestClassifier class is now instantiable, however it raises a ValueError when trying to use the fit method:
[Link to gist with error information (linked as a gist, as the printout is quite long)](https://gist.github.com/OliverMatthews/2ba6145cb1396fb584ada2384fe1e077#file-error_info)

It seems the value "entropy" is not valid for the attribute 'criterion', even though this is currently the default value for that attribute when instantiating ComposableTimeSeriesForestClassifier objects.

Running print(tsf.estimator.get_params().keys()) gives the following:

```
`dict_keys(['memory', 'steps', 'verbose', 'extract', 'clf', 'extract__features', 'extract__max_length', 'extract__min_length', 'extract__n_intervals', 'extract__random_state', 'clf__ccp_alpha', 'clf__class_weight', 'clf__criterion', 'clf__max_depth', 'clf__max_features', 'clf__max_leaf_nodes', 'clf__min_impurity_decrease', 'clf__min_samples_leaf', 'clf__min_samples_split', 'clf__min_weight_fraction_leaf', 'clf__random_state', 'clf__splitter'])`
```
good work, keep digging! We can discuss at our next  meeting

issue.title: TimeSeriesForest Classifier Fix

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.

Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->
Fixes #1536 


#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented.
-->
Fixed a bug preventing usage of ComposableTimeSeriesForestClassifier.

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?
<!--
If your contribution does add a new hard dependency, we may suggest to initially develop your contribution in a separate companion package in https://github.com/sktime/ to keep external dependencies of the core sktime package to a minimum.
-->
No new dependencies.

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?
<!-- This section is particularly useful if you have a pull request that is still in development. You can guide the reviews to focus on the parts that are ready for their comments. We suggest using bullets (indicated by * or -) and filled checkboxes [x] here -->
An abstract method in sklearn called _set_oob_score_and_attributes was implemented to allow instantiation of ComposableTimeSeriesForestClassifier objects, but with just `pass` in the body of the method. This might need to be implemented properly in the future, but isn't currently used.

#### Any other comments?
<!--
Please be aware that we are a loose team of volunteers so patience is necessary; assistance handling other issues is very welcome. We value all user contributions, no matter how minor they are. If we are slow to review, either the pull request needs some benchmarking, tinkering, convincing, etc. or more likely the reviewers are simply busy. In either case, we ask for your understanding during the review process.
-->
None.

#### PR checklist
<!--
Please go through the checklist below. Please feel free to remove points if they are not applicable.
-->

##### For all contributions
- [X] I've added myself to the [list of contributors](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/.all-contributorsrc).
- [ ] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [X] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.

##### For new estimators
- [ ] I've added the estimator to the online documentation.
- [ ] I've updated the existing example notebooks or provided a new one to showcase how my estimator works.


<!--
Thanks for contributing!
-->
